file_content.text: My forces will stomp out the remaining Republic scum.
Cerik's gone and his spaceport is in flames.
Magnificent! I hear you demolished their assault cannons, too. Crushing their base will be easy now.
Excellent! Those assault cannons hit my men hard, but they're pushing back to take the base.
Darth Gravus will want to hear the details.
That I do. But first, I want to personally thank our champion.
Indeed. But first I want to personally congratulate the victors.
With Master Cerik's death, this planet's reconstruction will crumble. The civilians who escaped will spread news of his defeat.
Master Cerik's death marks the end of the Republic's planetary restoration.
Soon Taris will be completely ruined, a tribute to the power of the Sith, the Empire... and you.
Taris is ours at last.
Your victory will be long remembered.
Another job well done.
Your loyalty will be recognized.
I enjoyed the destruction.
There's much bliss to be had from this planet's annihilation. And it's not over yet.
My power is incredible.
You don't have to convince me.
But there's still the matter of Thana. She hasn't returned, and I no longer feel her presence on Taris.
She served her purpose, so I disposed of her.
I killed Thana.
I suspected as much.
You've proven to be the more powerful Sith.
Under normal circumstances, I'd strike you down, but considering the wounds you inflicted on the Republic... I'll ignore my grievance.
Cerik was too strong for Thana. She fell to his lightsaber.
[Lie] The Jedi defeated her.
Interesting. Thana had a bright, violent future ahead of her. Her death is most unfortunate.
With the Republic crushed, we can destroy this planet in peace--especially now that Thana's gone on to torment another world.
Thanks to your actions, Taris will stand as a shining testament to the Empire's supremacy.
And like Darth Malak, you'll be remembered as the Sith responsible for securing this planet's destruction.
And you'll enter history as the Intelligence operative responsible for this planet's downfall.
And you'll go down in history as the lone mercenary capable of tearing down an entire planet.
And you'll always be remembered as the destroyer of this miserable planet.
And you'll go down in history as the destroyers of this wretched planet.
The Republic base is under siege. Now's our chance to break them!
Darth Gravus is eager to speak with you.
We must act quickly before the Republic deploys reinforcements. Lord Shaythin--begin the attack.
At once, my lord.
The final battle for Taris has begun. If we're to demolish this planet, you and Thana must join forces.
I'm willing to put aside our differences... if she is.
Fine.
No. You've dragged me down long enough!
I've been looking forward to some one-on-one time.
[Flirt] Gladly.
Thana and I don't mix well.
You're just afraid I'll outmatch you. I won't work with this weakling, Gravus.
I'm not getting anywhere near that crazy Sith.
No way I'm working with her.
Consider it a chance to prove who's the most powerful.
I don't need to prove anything! I work alone, or not at all!
The Republic's annihilation demands your complete cooperation, Thana.
I'll help, Gravus, if only to prepare for the day I strike you down.
Splendid. Your mission is twofold: Blow up the Republic spaceport, and eliminate the leader of their reconstruction efforts--a powerful Jedi Master named Cerik.
Such a loss will be devastating. The entire galaxy will take note.
The Republic will be shamed.
What better way to drive them off than humiliation by defeat?
The Republic won't quickly recover from that one-two punch.
That's going to leave a mark.
Their wound must be painful enough to discourage their return.
How do we blow the spaceport?
The energy reserve needed to rebuild a planet is highly unstable. Thana will overload it, with your assistance.
I don't like my odds.
You crippled the Republic's defenses. If anyone's suited for this mission, you are.
Once Master Cerik falls, the Republic will be forced to abandon Taris. The spaceport's destruction will block their reinforcements and trap the doomed survivors here.
Darth Gravus, the attack's underway. Republic transports are in orbit, headed for their spaceport.
They're trying to flee. If we don't kill Master Cerik now, he'll return with a full occupation force.
I'll remove Cerik and end his pathetic reconstruction.
Leave the Jedi to me.
Be careful. That Jedi knows he's fighting for more than himself.
I've got a blaster with Cerik's name on it.
Leave the Jedi to me.
Make your shots count. That Jedi won't fall easily.
Cerik will die... badly.
Show our enemies what it means to spit in the Empire's face.
Kill Cerik? Guess I can try.
Such lukewarm assurance will have to do.
Infiltrate the Republic base, disable the spaceport's safety measures, then meet Thana in the lower levels. Only together can you destroy the Republic's dreams.
And don't keep me waiting!
If you get the chance, take out the Republic's assault cannons. They're making life painful for our boys.
Darth Gravus. It's time.
Prepare your assault. I thinned out the Republic forces.
And I killed more than my share.
Darth Gravus. It appears we're ready.
I disabled the Republic's shields. It's all up to Thana now.
I killed 'em all. Didn't even break a sweat.
Fantastic work. Both of you.
Excellent job, all of you.
Root out that Republic scum. Then we'll launch our attack.
Lord Shaythin, at your service. I was relieved to hear you'll be leading our assault.
If your command of the Force is any indication, this will be a proud day for all Sith.
Consider it a testament to your skill. Mercenaries don't usually spearhead Imperial attacks.
Judging by your track record, the Republic's grip on Taris is about to be broken.
Darth Gravus. Your friend has arrived.
Darth Gravus. They've arrived.
You've performed well. Taris is scarred, the Republic's support weakened. I trust you're ready to deliver the killing blow.
The Republic won't survive another day on Taris.
Ready and willing.
Such conviction will prove necessary in the fight ahead.
How do you plan on breaking the Republic?
What's involved?
Sure, why not?
I hope you're saving your enthusiasm for the battlefield.
Depends on the pay.
The Empire will pay. But first, you must deliver this planet.
Centuries ago, Darth Malak began the destruction of Taris. We're about to complete his work.
We will crush the Republic reconstruction and the Jedi responsible. Thanks to you, they're cornered in their base--their final sanctuary on Taris.
And soon to be their tomb. Don't worry, Gravus--I'll tear down that base, then soak Taris with Republic blood.
The Republic's annihilation requires great power, something you'll never have.
You will fail.
Devastation deserves to be drawn out, appreciated. You'll just make a mess.
Amateur.
I'm capable of more than you know.
This operation demands an expert, not some rabid attack dog.
You're not fit for the job.
A little carnage is exactly what the Republic needs.
I'll demolish the base myself.
This is my job.
A merc can never compete with a Sith's power.
Who invited you, Thana?
What are you doing here?
Taris is my hunting ground. I go where I want.
I was hoping you'd grace us with your presence.
[Flirt] Hello, beautiful.
Come closer and I'll grace you with my lightsaber.
When you get killed, I hope I'm there to watch... and laugh.
That's suicide. Do it.
You'll never get the pleasure.
Thana, I knew you'd come running at the first scent of blood.
Unfortunately, the base's approach is infested with Republic forces. They're blocking our army's advance.
Rain bombs on their heads.
They're shielded. Only close combat will work.
Shields or not, I want them pulverized.
They'll need more than shields to escape me.
Consider them pulverized.
And me. I'm not passing up a good fight.
Without their defenses, Thana can catch the Republic forces off guard.
I'll bring down their shields.
Break the machines if you want. I'm more of a blood-and-bruises woman.
Clear the battlefield. Then we'll hit the Republic base and finally drive them off Taris.
The Republic's scared. I can smell it.
Don't waste time mourning her.
